body:
CompilationDependencies::DependOnNoUndetectableObjectsProtector implementation and ProtectorDependency internals in compiler/compilation-dependencies.cc:

Key points:
- DependOnNoUndetectableObjectsProtector() calls DependOnProtector(MakeRef(broker_, broker_->isolate()->factory()->no_undetectable_objects_protector()));
- ProtectorDependency::IsValid checks the PropertyCell value equals Protectors::kProtectorValid; Install registers the property cell with DependentCode::kPropertyCellChangedGroup.
- CompilationDependencies::DependOnProtector caches property cell as protector and records a ProtectorDependency if the cell value equals kProtectorValid.

Why interesting: Shows how a protector dependency is recorded and installed so that generated code can be invalidated when the protector is changed.

file_line: compiler/compilation-dependencies.cc around DependOnNoUndetectableObjectsProtector and ProtectorDependency definition
explanation: Records the exact code and mechanisms by which compilation records protector dependencies and installs them into DependentCode so that deopt/invalidation occur when protectors are toggled.
